content:
My name is Markus Peschl. Currently, I am a Master’s student of Applied Mathematics at the Delft University of Technology. On the theoretical side, my research interests lie in probabilistic models, stochastic processes and their applications to reinforcement learning. As a consequence, I am mainly interested in the study of uncertainty quantification for sequential decision making, Bayesian deep learning and optimal planning in (partially observable) Markov decision processes.
Regarding applications of reinforcement learning, I am excited about intelligent solutions in automation for sustainability as well as advancing the progress of data-driven personalized healthcare.
Outside of mathematics, I like to spend my time playing the piano and maximizing my fitness function through calisthenics and bouldering.
summary: My name is Markus Peschl. Currently, I am a Master’s student of Applied Mathematics at the Delft University of Technology. On the theoretical side, my research interests lie in probabilistic models, stochastic processes and their applications to reinforcement learning.
title: Markus Peschl

content:
What search engine do you use?
 Ecosia seems cool but I’ll have to go with DuckDuckGo.    Favorite Linux distributions?
 Ubuntu for ease of use, Arch Linux for customizability.    Which songs do you like to play on the piano?
 Mostly classical/romantic music, but I would love to learn jazz in the future. Some of my current most liked pieces:  Ravel - Sonatine, No. 2, “Mouvement de Menuet” (First movement is great too, never played the third one.) Debussy: Suite Bergamasque - II. Menuet Various pieces in Bach’s Well Tempered Clavier, particularly the prelude and fugue in C-sharp major, BWV 848  Beethoven: Sonata No.6 in F Major, Op.10 No.2 Schumann’s Papillons      What’s the most beautiful theorem?
 If I really have to choose, I would say I am a big fan of the dominated convergence theorem. It’s easy enough to understand with undergraduate measure theory and opens a vast and versatile area of applications. On one day you use it to find the limit of an infinite series and on another day you use it to prove completeness of a metric space. Quite beautiful if you ask me.
summary:
What search engine do you use?
 Ecosia seems cool but I’ll have to go with DuckDuckGo.    Favorite Linux distributions?
 Ubuntu for ease of use, Arch Linux for customizability.
title: Q&A
